intro: Blachia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine blachia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Blachia philippinensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
